wiki.summary: Rihanna returns from a music hiatus with “Lift Me Up,” the lead single from the Black Panther: Wakanda Forever movie soundtrack, titled "Wakanda Forever: The Album", released in 2022. This marks Rihanna’s first solo release since her eighth album "ANTI" in January 2016. Rihanna announced the song via Twitter two days before its release, after Marvel teased it the day before. The record was written alongside Ludwig Göransson and Ryan Coogler Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: Rihanna returns from a music hiatus with “Lift Me Up,” the lead single from the Black Panther: Wakanda Forever movie soundtrack, titled "Wakanda Forever: The Album", released in 2022. This marks Rihanna’s first solo release since her eighth album "ANTI" in January 2016. Rihanna announced the song via Twitter two days before its release, after Marvel teased it the day before. The record was written alongside Ludwig Göransson and Ryan Coogler, who composed the movie’s score and directed the film, respectively, as well as Nigerian rising artist Tems, as a tribute to the late Chadwick Boseman, who played King T’Challa, the protagonist on the original Black Panther The song debuted and peaked at #2 on the Billboard Hot 100 after being released on October 28, 2022 Read more on Last.fm.
